intro: Gomphocarpus kamerunensis, commonly known as the Cameroon milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are typically oval-shaped with serrated edges. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. Gomphocarpus kamerunensis is often found in open woodland and savanna habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
